title: spack unload does not reliably undo PYTHONPATH changes (etc?)

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->
If I `spack load py-biopython` and then `spack unload py-biopython`, PYTHONPATH still has a value added by the load.  This seems wrong (and in my case, causes problems).

This might be true for other env vars as well.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
mkc@talapas-ln2 ~ 4$ echo $PYTHONPATH

mkc@talapas-ln2 ~ 5$ spack load py-biopython
mkc@talapas-ln2 ~ 6$ echo $PYTHONPATH
/gpfs/packages/spack/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-broadwell/gcc-8.2.0/py-biopython-1.73-yix2k5zpp4qtk3akwyhq5ju7xu5uavj7/lib/python3.7/site-packages:/gpfs/packages/spack/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-broadwell/gcc-8.2.0/py-numpy-1.19.0-cqlbp2hbk3majov6g6ppe2rd3fiojj22/lib/python3.7/site-packages:/gpfs/packages/spack/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-broadwell/gcc-8.2.0/py-numpy-1.19.0-cqlbp2hbk3majov6g6ppe2rd3fiojj22/lib/python3.7/site-packages
mkc@talapas-ln2 ~ 7$ spack unload py-biopython
mkc@talapas-ln2 ~ 8$ echo $PYTHONPATH
/gpfs/packages/spack/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-broadwell/gcc-8.2.0/py-biopython-1.73-yix2k5zpp4qtk3akwyhq5ju7xu5uavj7/lib/python3.7/site-packages:/gpfs/packages/spack/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-broadwell/gcc-8.2.0/py-numpy-1.19.0-cqlbp2hbk3majov6g6ppe2rd3fiojj22/lib/python3.7/site-packages:/gpfs/packages/spack/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-broadwell/gcc-8.2.0/py-numpy-1.19.0-cqlbp2hbk3majov6g6ppe2rd3fiojj22/lib/python3.7/site-packages
mkc@talapas-ln2 ~ 9$ spack find --loaded
==> 18 installed packages
-- linux-rhel7-broadwell / gcc@8.2.0 ----------------------------
bzip2@1.0.8  gdbm@1.18.1     libbsd@0.10.0  libiconv@1.16   ncurses@6.2      openssl@1.1.1g   python@3.7.7  sqlite@3.31.1  xz@5.2.5
expat@2.2.9  gettext@0.20.2  libffi@3.3     libxml2@2.9.10  openblas@0.3.10  py-numpy@1.19.0  readline@8.0  tar@1.32       zlib@1.2.11
```

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->
* **Spack:** 0.16.2-3081-31bca57
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-rhel7-broadwell
* **Concretizer:** original
